title: PPC graphs - terms of trade - watches and radios

content.prompt: Using equal amounts of labor hours, Country X and Country Y can each produce the number of watches and radios shown in the production possibilities curves above. Based on the information, which of the following is true?

choices.label: Country X has an absolute advantage in the production of both watches and radios and a comparative advantage in the production of watches.
Country Y has an absolute advantage in the production of both watches and radios and a comparative advantage in the production of radios.
Countries X and Y can engage in a mutually advantageous trade by exchanging 1 watch for 1 radio.
Country Y is willing to give up 2 watches in exchange for 1 radio from Country X.
Country X is willing to give up 2 radios in exchange for 1 watch from Country Y.

topic.text: 1.3: Comparative Advantage and Gains from Trade

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Interpret a specific economic outcome using quantitative data or calculations.
